base.description: Use this as the default border radius width.

focus.description: Use this as the default focus border radius width.

lg.description: Use this border radius for big umbrella UI elements.

circle.description: Use this for creating pill shaped chips and similar.

base.description: Use this as the default border width.

thick.description: Use this exceptional for bolder border width.

thicker.description: Use this ticker border width for selected indications as eg in the tab navigation.

500.description: This is our official brand color

family.description: Roboto is the default font family used in the user interface of all our applications.

regular.description: Use regular as default font weight for body text.

bold.description: Use bold as default font weight for titles and to emphasis parts of the body text.

4xl.description: Use this for H1 headings on kiosk.

2xl.description: Use this for H2 headings on kiosk.

md.description: Use this as base font size as well as H3 headings.

sm.description: Use this as small font size as well as small headings.

xs.description: Use this for labels or captions, never for important information.

default.description: Use this as default letter spacing.

relaxed.description: Use this as relaxed letter spacing for text in capitals, like on buttons.

xl.description: Combine this line height with font-size-xl.

lg.description: Combine this line height with font-size-lg or font-size-md for long copy.

md.description: Combine this line height with font-size-md or font-size-sm for long copy.

sm.description: Combine this line height with font-size-sm.

xs.description: Combine this line height with font-size-xs or font-size-sm in capital letters.

base.description: This is our default background. Also use for the background of elements that appear to have no background in a resting state, such as subtle buttons and menu items.

hover.description: Use for the default background in a hovered state.

active.description: Use for the default background in an active state.

selected.description: Use for the default background in a selected state.

disabled.description: Use for default backgrounds in a disabled state.

base.description: A secondary background for the UI commonly used for grouping items, such as cards, tabs navigation, filter bar or the column right.

hover.description: Use for the background on surfaces in a hovered state.

active.description: Use for the background on surfaces in an active state.

base.description: Use for the background on surfaces that need little emphasis, such as the header of tables.

hover.description: Use for the background on weak surfaces in a hovered state.

active.description: Use for the background on weak surfaces in an active state.

base.description: Use for the background on surfaces that need extra emphasis, such as the navigation bar.

hover.description: Use for the background on strong surfaces in a hovered state.

active.description: Use for the background on strong surfaces in an active state.

base.description: Use for backgrounds of small UI elements, such as chips.

hover.description: Use for backgrounds of small UI elements in a hovered state.

active.description: Use for backgrounds of small UI elements in an active state.

selected.description: Use for backgrounds of small UI elements in a selected state.

strong.description: Use for strong backgrounds of small UI elements, such as tooltips.

base.description: Use for backgrounds of primary buttons.

hover.description: Use for backgrounds of primary buttons in a hovered state.

active.description: Use for backgrounds of primary buttons in an active state.

selected.description: Use for backgrounds of primary buttons in a selected state.

hover.description: Use for backgrounds of secondary and text buttons in a hovered state.

active.description: Use for backgrounds of secondary and text buttons in an active state.

error.description: Use for background in error messaging and other critical occasion.

success.description: Use for background in success messages and to communicate a favourable outcome.

warning.description: Use for background in warning messages and occasion emphasizing caution.

info.description: Use for background in info messages or to communicate something is new.

archive.description: Use for background in archive messages or to communicate something is no longer relevant.

base.description: Use for background of form UI elements, such as text fields.

active.description: Use for backgrounds of form UI elements in an active state.

hover.description: Use for backgrounds of form UI elements in a hovered state.

disabled.description: Use for backgrounds of form UI elements in a disabled state.

base.description: Use for backgrounds of form UI elements in checked state.

hover.description: Use for backgrounds of form UI elements in checked state.

active.description: Use for backgrounds of form UI elements in checked state.

error.description: Use for backgrounds of form UI elements in checked error state.

disabled.description: Use for backgrounds of form UI elements in a checked disabled state.

overlay.description: Use for the screen overlay that appears with modal dialogs.

loading.description: Use for the screen overlay that appears with loading states.

base.description: Use to visually group or separate UI elements, such as flat cards or side panel dividers.

strong.description: Use as a stronger seperator when the base border isn't sufficient.

focus.description: Use for focus rings of elements in a focus state.

error.description: Use for borders indicating errors and other critical occasion.

disabled.description: Use for borders of elements in a disabled state.

base.description: Use for borders of primary buttons.

hover.description: Use for borders of primary buttons in a hovered state.

active.description: Use for borders of primary buttons in an active state.

base.description: Use for borders of form UI elements, such as text fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons.

focus.description: Use for borders of form UI elements in a focus state.

hover.description: Use for borders of form UI elements in an active state.

active.description: Use for borders of form UI elements in an active state.

disabled.description: Use for borders of form UI elements in a disabled state.

error.description: Use for borders of form UI elements in an error state.

base.description: Use for icons paired with color-text-base.

weak.description: Use for default standalone icons as well as paired with color-text-weak.

success.description: Use for icons in success messages and to communicate a favourable outcome.

warning.description: Use for icons in warning messages and occasion emphasizing caution.

error.description: Use for icons in error messaging and other critical occasion.

info.description: Use for icons in info messages or to communicate something is new.

archive.description: Use for icons in archive messages or to communicate something is no longer relevant.

inverse.description: Use for icons on bold backgrounds.

disabled.description: Use for icons in a disabled state.

checked.description: Use for icons in a checked state as in the switch component.

base.description: Use for icons paired with color-text-brand.

hover.description: Use for icons paired with color-text-brand in hovered state.

active.description: Use for icons paired with color-text-brand in active state.

bold.description: Use for icons that reinforce our brand in the original honeycomb red.

base.description: Use for links in a default state.

hover.description: Use for links in a hovered state. Add an underline for hovered states.

active.description: Use for links in a active state.

base.description: Used for the main text color throughout the UI.

weak.description: Use for secondary text, such as labels, navigation,  tabs, and supporting texts.

disabled.description: Use for text in a disabled state.

hover.description: Use for text in a hovered state.

inverse.description: Use for text on strong backgrounds.

error.description: Use for text in error messaging and other critical text.

warning.description: Use for text in warning messages and text emphasizing caution.

success.description: Use for text in success messages and to communicate a favourable outcome..

info.description: Use for text in info messages or to communicate something is new.

archive.description: Use for text in archive messages or to communicate something is no longer relevant.

base.description: Use for text that reinforces our brand. Also used for action items such as buttons.

hover.description: Use for text on action items in hover state.

active.description: Use for text on action items in active state.

base.description: Use still needs to be defined.

checkbox.description: Use this to define the checkbox size height and width.

button.description: Use this to define the button size height and width.

input.description: Use this to define the input size height.

sm.description: Use this sizing token for smaller icons.

md.description: Use this default sizing token for most icons in components.

lg.description: Use this sizing token for bigger icons.

chip.description: Use this to define the chip size height.

width.description: Use this to define the switch size width.

height.description: Use this to define the switch size height.

25.description: Use this inline as horizontal spacing as seperator of small text.

50.description: Use this inline as horizontal spacing for elements within a component.

100.description: Use this inline as tight horizontal spacing between components with a strong relation.

200.description: Use this inline as default horizontal spacing between components.

300.description: Use this inline as horizontal spacing between component groups.

400.description: Use this inline as spacious horizontal spacing between main sections.

600.description: Use this inline as spacious horizontal spacing for text sections.

50.description: Use this stack as tight vertical spacing between labels in form components.

100.description: Use this stack as tight vertical spacing between components with a strong relation.

200.description: Use this stack as default vertical spacing between components.

300.description: Use this stack as vertical spacing between component groups.

400.description: Use this stack as vertical spacing between sections.

600.description: Use this stack as spacious vertical spacing between main sections.

25.description: Use this padding for justify spacing in eg container elements.

50.description: Use this padding for justify spacing in eg container elements.

75.description: Use this padding for justify spacing in eg container elements.

100.description: Use this default padding for small components like a button.

150.description: Use this padding for alignment in components such as the checkbox field

200.description: Use this padding for components and elements on a card or a surface.

300.description: Use this padding exceptionally for bigger components and elements on a card.

50.description: Use this smaller stretched padding for compact components like chips.

100.description: Use this stretched padding for components like menu or navigation items and filled input fields.

150.description: Use this spacious stretched padding for eg  table items.
